page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block lies on the edge of London and was mainly developed in the 1930s with some post-war infilling. Old communities at Hayes, Keston and Bromley Common have been swallowed up by this new housing. Yet over half the block has yet to be developed thanks to a determined effort against continual pressure to erode the Green Belt. A sizable farm still operates and other land is used for a variety of recreational purposes. Hayes Common and Sparrow Wood are mainly wooded areas open to the public. Transport is important to the local people as many commute. Bromley remains a major bottleneck for cars and most London commuters travel by train from Hayes, Orpington or Bromley South.
